metadata.title: CVE-2023-29455 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Reflected XSS attacks, also known as non-persistent attacks, occur when amalicious script is reflected off a web application to the victim'sbrowser. The script is activated through a link, which sends a request to awebsite with a vulnerability that enables execution of malicious scripts.

criterions.comment: zabbix: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
